alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 3:59PM CDT until August 31 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble and Mason. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms...from Telegraph to Junction and Segovia, and between Mason and Loyal Valley. Movement was northwest at 15 mph. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, Mason, Yates Crossing, London, Long Mountain, Segovia, Streeter, Grit, South Llano River State Park, Camp Air, Hilda, Hedwigs Hill, Katemcy, Art, Telegraph, Loyal Valley, Fredonia, Roosevelt, Pontotoc and The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 434 and 477. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River, Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, RM 385 crossing Perdenales River, RM 385 crossing Falls Prong, US HWY 377 crossing 2 miles North of Telegraph. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
